title: Coding Standard to FLS Mapping
description: Schema for mapping coding standard guidelines (MISRA/CERT) to Ferrocene Language Specification (FLS) sections

fls_version.description: Version of the Ferrocene Language Specification used for mapping

mapping_date.description: Date when the mapping was created/updated (YYYY-MM-DD)

methodology.description: Description of how mappings were determined

total_guidelines.description: Total number of guidelines in the standard

mapped.description: Guidelines with FLS mappings (direct or partial)

rust_prevents.description: Guidelines where Rust's design prevents the issue

mapping_entry.description: A single guideline's mapping to FLS sections

accepted_matches.description: FLS sections that were matched to this guideline during manual review, with justification for each

fls_id.description: The accepted FLS ID (section-level or paragraph-level)

fls_section.description: Human-readable FLS section number (e.g., '6.15' or '6.-2.1'). May be null for FLS IDs that don't map to numbered sections.

fls_title.description: Human-readable title of the FLS section

score.description: The similarity score (0-1) that was calculated for this match. Null for manually-added paragraph IDs.

reason.description: Why this FLS section was chosen - should reference specific FLS legality rules or content

rejected_matches.description: High-similarity FLS matches (â‰¥0.5) that were rejected during manual review. Used to improve similarity calculation.

fls_section.description: Human-readable FLS section number (e.g., '6.15'). May be null for FLS IDs that don't map to numbered sections.

fls_title.description: Human-readable title of the FLS section

score.description: The similarity score (0-1) that was calculated for this match

reason.description: Why this match was rejected despite high similarity score

fls_sections.description: Human-readable FLS section numbers and paragraphs (e.g., ['15.1', '15.1:3', '17.2']). Deprecated: use accepted_matches instead.

fls_rationale_type.description: Explains the relationship between the guideline and the FLS sections: direct_mapping=rule maps directly to these FLS concepts, rust_alternative=Rust has a different/better mechanism (FLS shows what Rust uses instead), rust_prevents=Rust's design prevents the issue (FLS shows how), no_equivalent=C concept doesn't exist in Rust (FLS shows related Rust constructs for context), partial_mapping=some aspects map directly, others don't

applicability_all_rust.description: How this guideline applies to ALL Rust code (including unsafe): direct=maps cleanly, partial=concept differs in Rust, not_applicable=C/C++ specific with no Rust equivalent, rust_prevents=Rust's design prevents the issue, unmapped=needs expert mapping

applicability_safe_rust.description: How this guideline applies to SAFE Rust code only: direct=maps cleanly, partial=concept differs in Rust, not_applicable=C/C++ specific with no Rust equivalent, rust_prevents=Rust's design prevents the issue, unmapped=needs expert mapping

misra_rust_category.description: MISRA's adjusted category for Rust (from MISRA C:2025 ADD-6). Only applicable to MISRA standards.

misra_rust_comment.description: MISRA's comment on Rust applicability (from MISRA C:2025 ADD-6). Only applicable to MISRA standards.

confidence.description: Confidence level in the mapping accuracy (null when unmapped)

notes.description: High-level summary of the mapping rationale. Detailed justifications should be in accepted_matches and rejected_matches.
